content: The Administration requested a budget authority of $67.551 billion for Commerce, Justice, Science, and Related Agencies for FY2010, representing an 11.1% increase over the previous year. The House passed a bill with $67.695 billion for FY2010, slightly exceeding the Administration's request. The Senate passed H.R. 2847 with a $67.953 billion budget for CJS, representing an 11.8% increase over FY2009. The Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2009 provided $205.1 million for CJS departments, with $40.0 million for Commerce and $165.1 million for DOJ. The Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2010 (P.L. 111-117) resolved differences between House and Senate versions of the Transportation-HUD appropriations bill. It included $68.705 billion for CJS, a 13.0% increase over FY2009. President Obama also signed the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 (P.L. 111-5) into law. The American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 (ARRA) provided $15.922 billion for CJS departments and agencies, with $7.916 billion for Commerce, $4.002 billion for Justice, and $4.004 billion for science agencies. Various reports and acts were used as sources for the funding amounts. The FY2010 enacted amounts for CJS totaled $67.551 billion, a 11.1% increase from FY2009.
